meanings.sent1: She sazes the remote control, deciding what to watch on TV.
meanings.sent2: The teacher sazes the classroom, ensuring everyone follows the rules.
meanings.sent3: The cat sazes the house, making sure no mice enter.
meanings.sent4: The captain sazes the ship, guiding it through stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: He sazes the garden, carefully tending to each plant's needs.

meanings.definition: a person who is in charge or has authority
meanings.sent1: The principal is the sazes of the school, making important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The CEO is the sazes of the company, leading the employees.
meanings.sent3: The queen bee is the sazes of the hive, directing the worker bees.
meanings.sent4: The coach is the sazes of the team, guiding them to victory.
meanings.sent5: The president is the sazes of the country, overseeing its operations.
